familysearch.title: FamilySearch
summary: Began as an intern during the summer of 2020. Starting right after the Covid shutdown, I have worked remotely throughout my tenure here. I was made a contracted employee in December of 2020.
While here, I have learned to work in a front-end team inside of a large organization. We work in an Agile environment, with 2-week iterations and daily stand-up meetings.

My work has consisted of developing React components to build out UI for users that come to FamilySearch.org. As part of the Records Improvement Team, I assisted in developing tools to allow users to interact with computer-generated data to improve the AI used to scan images and extract data from the records.

caravel.title: Caravel Associates
summary: Began the development process on a mobile application called Klapr that was designed to be a platform that would support street performers. We utilized React Native to allow for cross-platform development.
As the lead developer for the project, I took part in selecting the technology stack that we would use. We held weekly meetings to go over our progress and assign out new tasks.

ybaShirts.title: YBA Shirts
summary: Front End duties include using React components and Material Design to build a simple but beautiful company portal website. Back End duties include using Node and MySQL to add functionality and access to the database and the resources needed for the company to function properly. Most recently, I integrated Quickbooks Online into the website for the Accounting Department to handle invoices and bills without leaving the company portal site.

byuAthletics.title: BYU Athletics
summary: Front End duties include using Angular components while currently switching over to a Drupal-based front end. Back End duties include using Drupal as a CMS and creating custom modules to allow functionality for editors who provide stories to byucougars.com. Rapid response to bugs found by front end users to help maintain a clean and fast performance for users throughout the world.

symantec.title: Symantec
summary: First response to customers who had purchased the CASB product, a cloud-based security solution. Multitasked by working on multiple cases for multiple customers, often communicating via phone or email. Helped non-technical customers by walking them through solutions to the issues they were having.

byuOIT.title: BYU Office of IT
summary: First introduction to Web Development, spent several months learning the basics of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Created a linking website where BYU students would have a collection of useful links to other sites.

entrata.title: Entrata
summary: I act as an extension of hundreds of leasing offices throughout the country. I talk to people who are looking to lease apartments, residents who have maintenance or other issues, and a lot of other miscellaneous calls.

byuVending.title: BYU Vending
summary: I move product from the warehouse to the individual vending machines on the campus of Brigham Young University. As part of this process, I collect money from the machine and ensure that we have accurate numbers on the inventory of the products in the machines.

vivint.title: Vivint
summary: Taking inbound phone calls from customers that have questions about their contracts or that wanted to cancel their accounts.
